tests.name: tt̄ cross-sections vs LHC data
tests.details:
tt̄ cross-section comparison:

  7TeV: CG = 172 pb, Data = 173.0 ± 9.4 pb (0.6%, 0.1σ) ✓
  8TeV: CG = 245 pb, Data = 242.9 ± 7.6 pb (0.9%, 0.3σ) ✓
  13TeV: CG = 832 pb, Data = 830.0 ± 35.2 pb (0.2%, 0.1σ) ✓
  13.6TeV: CG = 923 pb, Data = 887.0 ± 35.4 pb (4.1%, 1.0σ) ✓

NOTE: This is SM-EQUIVALENT — CG Feynman rules (Thm 6.1.1)
reproduce SM QCD amplitudes at low energy.
Agreement confirms CG consistency, not unique predictions.

tests.name: W/Z cross-sections at 13 TeV
tests.details:
W/Z cross-section comparison at 13 TeV:

W (total):
  CG prediction: 20.7 nb
  ATLAS data: 20.62 ± 0.55 nb
  Deviation: 0.39% (0.15σ)

Z → ℓℓ:
  CG prediction: 1.98 nb
  ATLAS data: 1.981 ± 0.040 nb
  Deviation: 0.05% (0.02σ)

W/Z ratio (reduced systematics):
  CG prediction: 10.6
  Data: 10.41 ± 0.35
  Deviation: 1.84% (0.55σ)

NOTE: SM-EQUIVALENT — Electroweak vertices use SM values.
CG contributes only QCD corrections.

tests.name: Higgs ggF production at 13 TeV
tests.details:
Higgs ggF production at 13 TeV:

CG prediction: 48.5 pb
ATLAS+CMS combined: 54.4 ± 5.5 pb
Deviation: 10.8% (1.07σ)

In CG framework:
  y_t^eff = (g_χ ω₀ v_χ)/(Λ v_H) η_t ≈ 1

This matches SM value, so Higgs production is unchanged.

NOTE: SM-EQUIVALENT at current precision.
CG-specific deviation requires sub-percent Higgs coupling measurements.

tests.name: α_s running consistency
tests.details:
α_s running consistency:

PDG value: α_s(M_Z) = 0.118 ± 0.0009

CG running (one-loop, N_f=5):
  α_s(M_Z) = 0.1180
  α_s(m_t) = 0.0997
  α_s(1 TeV) = 0.0698

CG claims:
  - Geometric origin α_s(M_P) = 1/64 (Thm 5.2.6)
  - RG running to low scales gives α_s(M_Z) ≈ 0.118

This is CONSISTENCY CHECK, not unique prediction.
The geometric origin gives same low-energy value as QCD.

For verification: Test α_s precision at FCC-ee (0.1% level)
to distinguish geometric vs arbitrary origin.

tests.name: High-pT form factor (p_T/Λ)² scaling
tests.details:
High-pT form factor prediction (GENUINE PREDICTION):

CG predicts: |M|² = |M_SM|² × (1 + c p_T²/Λ²)
where c ≈ 0.04 (from g_χ²/16π²), Λ = 10.0 TeV

Predictions:
  At p_T = 2 TeV: deviation = 0.64%
  At p_T = 3 TeV: deviation = 1.44%
  At p_T = 5 TeV: deviation = 4.0%

Current status:
  No significant deviation observed at p_T < 2.5 TeV
  Constraint: Λ > 8 TeV (consistent with Λ = 10 TeV)

FALSIFICATION CRITERIA:
  If high-pT excess observed with DIFFERENT scaling than (p_T/Λ)²,
  CG form factor prediction would be falsified.

Test strategy:
  HL-LHC (3000 fb⁻¹): Probe p_T ~ 3-4 TeV with ~5% precision
  FCC-hh (100 TeV): Direct access to ~10% deviations at p_T ~ 10 TeV

tests.name: ℓ=4 (not ℓ=2) angular anisotropy
tests.details:
ℓ=4 angular anisotropy (GENUINE PREDICTION):

CG predicts: dσ/dΩ ∝ 1 + ε_4 Y₄ᵐ(θ,φ)
where ε_4 ~ (E/M_P)² ≈ 6.7e-27 at TeV scale

KEY DISTINCTION:
  - CG: ONLY ℓ=4 (hexadecapole) from O_h stella symmetry
  - Other theories: May include ℓ=2 (quadrupole)

Current limits (Fermi-LAT):
  ε_4 < 1e-15
  ε_2 < 1e-15

CG prediction (6.7e-27) is far below current sensitivity.

FALSIFICATION CRITERIA:
  If ℓ=2 Lorentz violation detected: CG falsified
  (CG predicts ONLY ℓ=4 from stella octangula symmetry)

Test strategy:
  - Ultra-high-energy cosmic rays: Higher E/M_P ratio
  - GRB dispersion: Long baselines amplify effect
  - Precision angular measurements at FCC-ee

tests.name: QGP ξ = R_stella (energy-independent)
tests.details:
QGP coherence ξ = R_stella (GENUINE PREDICTION):

CG prediction: ξ = R_stella = 0.448 fm (energy-independent)

Standard QGP expectation: ξ ~ R_freeze-out (energy-dependent)

HBT measurements at short range:
  RHIC_200GeV: ξ = 0.45 ± 0.1 fm (0.0σ from CG) ✓
  LHC_2760GeV: ξ = 0.44 ± 0.08 fm (0.1σ from CG) ✓
  LHC_5020GeV: ξ = 0.46 ± 0.1 fm (0.1σ from CG) ✓

Energy independence check:
  Spread: 0.020 fm
  Average: 0.450 fm
  CG prediction: 0.448 fm

KEY TEST: ξ should NOT vary with √s_NN.
If ξ increases with energy (like freeze-out radius), CG falsified.

FALSIFICATION CRITERIA:
  Strong energy dependence of ξ_short would falsify CG.
  CG predicts constant ξ = R_stella at ALL energies.

tests.name: Higgs trilinear δλ₃ ~ 1-10%
tests.details:
Higgs trilinear coupling deviation (GENUINE PREDICTION):

CG predicts: λ₃ = λ₃^SM × (1 + δ_χ)
where δ_χ ~ 1%-10% from χ-Higgs portal

Current status:
  λ₃ constrained to within factor ~10 of SM
  Not yet sensitive to CG prediction

Future sensitivity:
  HL-LHC (3000 fb⁻¹): ~50% precision
  FCC-hh: ~5% precision (could test CG range)

FALSIFICATION CRITERIA:
  If λ₃ measured to be EXACTLY SM at sub-percent precision,
  CG prediction of ~1-10% deviation would be falsified.

Test strategy:
  - HH production at HL-LHC
  - Triple Higgs coupling at FCC-hh

tests.name: Cross-section energy scaling
tests.details:
Cross-section energy scaling:

tt̄ production scaling with √s:

Energy (TeV) | CG (pb) | Data (pb) | CG/Data
--------------------------------------------------
        7    |   172   |   173.0    | 0.994
        8    |   245   |   242.9    | 1.009
       13    |   832   |   830.0    | 1.002
     13.6    |   923   |   887.0    | 1.041

Scaling ratios:
  8/7 TeV:    CG = 1.424, Data = 1.404
  13/8 TeV:   CG = 3.396, Data = 3.417
  13.6/13 TeV: CG = 1.109, Data = 1.069

CG correctly reproduces parton luminosity scaling.

tests.name: Falsification criteria check
tests.details:
Falsification criteria check:

CG falsification conditions (none triggered):

1. ℓ=2 Lorentz violation detected
   Status: NOT OBSERVED
   CG predicts: Only ℓ=4 from stella octangula O_h symmetry

2. QGP coherence ξ varies with √s
   Status: NOT OBSERVED (within errors)
   CG predicts: ξ = R_stella = constant

3. High-pT excess inconsistent with (E/Λ)²
   Status: NO EXCESS SEEN at current precision
   CG predicts: Specific form factor scaling

4. α_s(M_Z) outside 0.10-0.13
   Status: α_s = 0.1180 ± 0.0009 (in range)
   CG requires: Consistent running from M_P

ALL FALSIFICATION CRITERIA: NOT TRIGGERED

CG remains consistent with all current LHC data.

tests.name: Dijet cross-sections at 13 TeV
tests.details:
Dijet cross-section comparison at 13 TeV:

  100-200GeV: CG/Data = 1.04 (0.3σ) ✓
  200-500GeV: CG/Data = 1.04 (0.4σ) ✓
  500-1000GeV: CG/Data = 1.05 (0.5σ) ✓
  1-2TeV: CG/Data = 1.05 (0.4σ) ✓

NOTE: SM-EQUIVALENT — CG QCD gives same dijet spectrum.
High-pT form factor effects emerge above 2 TeV.

tests.name: R_stella cross-validation
tests.details:
R_stella cross-validation:

Framework uses R_stella = 0.448 fm consistently:

1. String tension: √σ = ℏc/R_stella = 440.5 MeV
   FLAG 2024: √σ = 440 ± 30 MeV ✓

2. QGP coherence: ξ = R_stella = 0.448 fm
   HBT data: ξ ~ 0.45 ± 0.1 fm ✓

3. All LHC cross-sections computed with this scale

CONSISTENCY: Same geometric scale enters all predictions.
This is the framework's strength — single parameter determines multiple observables.
